dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.backend

Class AbstractCDSEngineBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.backend.AbstractCDSEngineBackend
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICDSEngineBackend
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CBackend

    public abstract class AbstractCDSEngineBackend
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICDSEngineBackend
    Abstract super class for cds backends that provides utility functions.

    Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

    Since:
    2008.b

      • assertKnownType

        public static void assertKnownType(CDSGenFile cdsFile,
                                   java.lang.Class<? extends CType> clazz)
        Asserts that the given class is a built-in type or already defined. If it hasn't been defined yet it will throw an exception.
        Parameters:
        cdsFile - Actual cds file to check for a previous type def.
        clazz - The clazz to check.
        Throws:
        CDSGenAPIException - if the given type has not yet been defined
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getKnownSuperclass

        public static java.lang.Class<? extends CType> getKnownSuperclass(CDSGenFile cdsFile,
                                                                  java.lang.Class<? extends CType> clazz)
        Returns the superclass of the given CType class that is a built-in type or already defined. If the superclass is not defined yet it will throw a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        cdsFile - File to look for previous typedefs of the superclass.
        clazz - The class to get the superclass.
        Returns:
        Superclass of the given class, never null.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getMembers

        @Deprecated
public static java.util.List<CType> getMembers(Struct struct)
        Deprecated. This method returns the members in their natural order. This is deprecated since the implementation of IMemberSorter (in 2010.a) which controls the order of struct members. Please use getMembers(Struct, IMemberSorter) instead and do not mix up both methods in your code.
        Returns a list of members declared by the given struct. If the struct implements the IConditionalMembers interface then only choosen members gets returned.
        Parameters:
        struct - The struct to return the members from.
        Returns:
        A list of members declared by the given struct, possible empty but never null.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getMembers

        public static java.util.List<CType> getMembers(Struct struct,
                                               IMemberSorter memberSorter)
        Returns a list of members declared by the given struct. If the struct implements the IConditionalMembers interface then only choosen members are returned. To get the members of a superclass of the given struct you have to use getMembers(Struct, Class, IMemberSorter).

        If a member sorter is given then the order of the returned members depends on the implementation of this sorter; except that the struct has another sorter assigned ( Struct.getMemberSorter())which will override the given memberSorter. If both sorters are unspecified (null) the members will be returned in their natural order.

        Parameters:
        struct - The struct to return the members from.
        memberSorter - A member sorter implementation which controls the order of the returned members, maybe null to get the members in their natural order in which they appear within the given struct.
        Returns:
        A list of members declared by the given struct, possible empty but never null.
        Since:
        2010.a

      • getMembers

        public static java.util.List<CType> getMembers(Struct struct,
                                               java.lang.Class<? extends Struct> structClazz,
                                               IMemberSorter memberSorter)
        Returns a list of members declared by the given struct resp. the given class that is the class of the struct or a superclass of it. If the struct implements the IConditionalMembers interface then only choosen members are returned.

        If a member sorter is given then the order of the returned members depends on the implementation of this sorter; except that the struct has another sorter assigned ( Struct.getMemberSorter())which will override the given memberSorter. If both sorters are unspecified (null) the members will be returned in their natural order.

        Parameters:
        struct - The struct to return the members from.
        structClazz - The class or a superclass of the given struct to get the members from.
        memberSorter - A member sorter implementation which controls the order of the returned members, maybe null to get the members in their natural order in which they appear within the given struct.
        Returns:
        A list of members declared by the given struct, possible empty but never null.
        Since:
        2010.a

      • getCompilerAbstraction

        public static CompilerAbstraction getCompilerAbstraction(CType var,
                                                         java.lang.Class<? extends CType> clazz,
                                                         CDSGenFile cdsFile)
        Returns Compiler abstraction associated with the given ctype.
        Parameters:
        var - CType variable to get the compiler abstraction for.
        clazz - Class or super class of the given variable.
        cdsFile - Actual cds file to look for previous attached compiler abstractions.
        Returns:
        Compiler abstraction the given var or null.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getFirstCell

        public static CType getFirstCell(Array<? extends CType> array)
        Returns the first cell of the given array. If the array consists of further arrays (multi-dimensional) the it returns the first inner most cell.
        Parameters:
        array - Array to get the first cell of.
        Returns:
        First cell of the array.
        Since:
        2008.b

      • getDefaultMemberSorter

        public static IMemberSorter getDefaultMemberSorter(CDSGenScope cdsGenScope)
        Searches a default IMemberSorter within the given scope. The member sorter can only be found if the scope contains a CTypeDescriptors attribute which has a default member sorter assigned.
        Parameters:
        cdsGenScope - The scope to search for a member sorter.
        Returns:
        The found IMemberSorter or null.
        Since:
        2010.a
